column1: A Ration Card is issued by the State Government to eligible families to purchase subsidized food grains under the Public Distribution System (PDS). It also serves as identity and address proof.
A Birth Certificate is an official document issued by the Municipal Authority recording a person's birth details. It is the primary proof of age and citizenship.
Aadhaar is a 12-digit unique identification number issued by the Unique Identification Authority of India. It serves as a universal identity and address proof across India.
PAN (Permanent Account Number) is issued by the Income Tax Department for financial and tax-related transactions. It is mandatory for filing Income Tax Returns.
A Passport is an official travel document issued by the Ministry of External Affairs. It certifies identity and nationality for international travel.
A Driving Licence is issued by the State Transport Authority permitting an individual to legally drive vehicles in India.
The Voter ID Card, also known as EPIC, is issued by the Election Commission of India to Indian citizens above 18 years of age for voting in elections.
A Marriage Certificate is an official proof of marriage issued by the Registrar of Marriages under applicable Indian marriage laws.
Educational Certificates are academic records issued by schools, colleges, or universities as proof of qualification and completion of education.
A Domicile Certificate (Residence Certificate) confirms that a person is a permanent resident of a particular state in India.

An Allotment Letter is an official document issued by an institution, authority, or organization confirming allocation of a seat, property, job, or service to an individual. It acts as provisional confirmation of selection or allotment.
Issued within 3-15 working days after selection.
The SSC Marksheet is issued after completion of Class 10 by the respective State Board or CBSE. It is proof of basic educational qualification and date of birth.
The HSC Marksheet is issued after completion of Class 12 by the education board. It is mandatory for higher education admissions.
An Income Certificate is issued by the Revenue Department certifying the annual income of an individual or family.
A Caste Certificate certifies that a person belongs to a particular Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST), or Other Backward Class (OBC) category.
A Caste Validity Certificate verifies the authenticity of the issued caste certificate through scrutiny by the Caste Scrutiny Committee.
A Non-Creamy Layer Certificate certifies that the applicant belongs to the OBC category and falls under the income limit prescribed by the Government.
A Nationality Certificate certifies that a person is a citizen of India.
A Transfer Certificate is issued by a school or college when a student leaves the institution. It certifies that the student has formally withdrawn.
A Gap Certificate is a self-declaration affidavit stating the reason for a break in education or employment.
A Rent Agreement is a legal contract between landlord and tenant outlining terms and conditions of property rental.

eKYC (Electronic Know Your Customer) is a digital, paperless process for verifying a customer's identity and address instantly, primarily using Aadhaar-based authentication or digital document verification. It replaces manual, paper-based checks, enabling secure, fast, and remote onboarding for financial services and other industries.
Key Features and Benefits of eKYC
* Instant Verification: Provides real-time, authenticated identity confirmation.
* Paperless & Remote: Eliminates the need for physical documents, enabling entirely online, contactless onboarding.
Reduces document forgery risks and uses biometric or OTP-based verification for high accuracy
* Cost-Efficient: Lowers operational costs related to paper, storage, and manual verification.
* Convenience: Allows users to complete KYC from anywhere, anytime.
* Banking & Finance: Opening bank accounts, taking loans, and investing.
* Telecom: Procuring SIM cards and new connections.
* Digital Services & Gaming: Registering for apps, UPI services, or online gaming to verify age.
* Aadhaar OTP-based: Requires an OTP sent to the mobile number linked with Aadhaar.
* Biometric-based: Uses fingerprints or facial recognition for authentication.
* Offline Paperless e-KYC: Uses a secure, digitally signed XML file provided by the user for offline verificatio
A legal document that defines a company's objectives, scope of activities, and relationship with shareholders.

The Memorandum of Association is the foundational charter of a company. It outlines the company's name, registered office, objectives, liability of members, capital structure, and scope of operations. A company cannot undertake activities beyond what is stated in its MoA.
* Establishes relationship between company and shareholders
* Identity and address proof of directors and shareholders
Updated only when business objectives or structure changes.
Company name, registered office, objectives, liability clause, capital clause.
A document that outlines the internal rules and governance structure of a company.
AOA defines how a company will be managed, including roles of directors, shareholder rights, meeting procedures, and voting rights. It acts as a rulebook for internal management.
* Defines rights and duties of directors
Director powers, meeting procedures, share transfer rules.
A unique identification number allotted to an individual intending to become a company director.
DIN is issued by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and is mandatory for anyone who wishes to act as a director in an Indian company. It ensures proper tracking of director compliance.
No renewal required; update if personal details change.
Director's name, date of birth, DIN number.
A legal agreement between shareholders outlining rights, responsibilities, and shareholding structure.
This agreement governs relationships among shareholders, including share transfers, voting rights, exit rights, dispute resolution, and dividend policies.
Shareholding ratio, voting rights, dispute resolution clauses.
An agreement among company founders defining roles, equity split, and responsibilities.
This agreement sets expectations between founders regarding ownership distribution, vesting schedule, decision-making authority, and exit terms.
Updated if ownership or roles change.
Equity split, vesting schedule, founder duties.
An official certificate issued by the Registrar of Companies confirming company formation.
It legally establishes a company as a registered entity and includes the Corporate Identification Number (CIN) and date of incorporation.
Company name, CIN, date of incorporation.
Legal protection for a brand name, logo, or symbol.
Trademark registration grants exclusive rights to use a brand identity and prevents others from copying it.
Trademark class, owner details, validity date.
A formal approval stating no objection to a particular action or activity.
NOC is issued by an authority, landlord, or organization to permit specific activities such as using premises as registered office.
Permanent Account Number issued by Income Tax Department for tax purposes.
PAN is mandatory for tax filings, opening bank accounts, and financial transactions in India.
A tax registration number used for tracking VAT-related transactions.
TIN was issued to businesses registered under VAT systems before GST implementation.
11) Goods and Services Taxpayer Identification Number (GSTIN)
Goods and Services Taxpayer Identification Number (GSTIN)
A unique identification number for businesses registered under GST.
GSTIN is mandatory for businesses exceeding prescribed turnover limits and enables tax collection and input credit claims.
No renewal; update if business details change.
Valid while GST registration is active.
GSTIN number, business name, state code.
A contract protecting confidential information from unauthorized disclosure.
An NDA is signed between parties to safeguard sensitive information such as trade secrets, business plans, and intellectual property.
A formal document offering employment to a candidate.
It outlines job role, salary, benefits, reporting structure, and employment terms.
Valid until employment begins or offer expires.
Salary, role, joining date, terms & conditions.
Additional compliance documents required when foreign nationals are directors or shareholders.
Includes notarized and apostilled identity proofs, passport copies, and address verification as per Indian regulations.
Updated if foreign director/shareholder details change.
15) Privacy Policy and Terms of Use
Privacy Policy and Terms of Use
Legal documents outlining how user data is collected, used, and website/app usage rules.
These documents ensure compliance with data protection laws and define rights and responsibilities of users interacting with the platform.
Updated when laws or business practices change.
Data usage policies, user rights, liability clauses.
Commonly Required Documents for Scholarship Forms
A standard list of documents typically required while applying for government or private scholarships.

Scholarship applications generally require applicants to submit identity proof, academic records, financial documents, and institutional verification certificates. These documents help authorities verify eligibility criteria such as income level, academic performance, category status, domicile, and bank details for direct benefit transfer. The exact list may vary depending on the scholarship scheme, state regulations, and institution requirements.
* To verify applicant identity and eligibility
* To process financial assistance through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT)
* Proof of Identity & Residence (Aadhaar card, PAN card, voter ID, passport)
* Academic Transcripts (10th, 12th, previous semester/year mark sheets)
* Income Certificate (issued by tehsildar), Form 16 or salary slip
* Bank Passbook (front page) or cancelled cheque
* Category Certificate (SC/ST/OBC/SEBC), Non-Creamy Layer Certificate, Disability Certificate (if applicable)
* Admission/Bonafide Certificate, Fee Receipt, School Leaving Certificate
* Domicile Certificate, Gap Certificate (if applicable), Passport-size Photograph

These platforms cover services across all states:
* National Government Services Portal: https://services.india.gov.in/ (General portal to find all services).
* DigiLocker (Digital Document Wallet): https://www.digilocker.gov.in/ (For storing/accessing documents)

For locally issued documents like Income, Caste, Domicile, and Birth/Death certificates, you should use the e-District portal specific to your state. A list of e-District portals for various states and union territories in India is available.
For additional state e-District portals, refer to MagicBricks website.
* UMANG App/Website: umang.gov.in offers access to numerous state and central government services in one place.
